title: Parque Puebla
content:
Parque Puebla is a shopping mall in the La Cienega area of Puebla City, Mexico, located between the Stadium District and the Instituto Tecnológico de Puebla near the Mexico City–Puebla tollway (150D).[1] It was developed by Fibra Danhos at a cost of 4.5 billion pesos (240 million U.S. dollars).[2] Governor Rafael Moreno of the State of Puebla inaugurated the center in January 2017.[1]

Parque Puebla is anchored by Sears and Liverpool department stores and a Cinepolis multi-cinema complex.

A Fiesta Inn hotel will be built at the complex,[3] and he 500-million-peso (28-million-dollar) "Michin" aquarium is set to be added to the complex in 2019.[4]

19°04′12″N 98°10′32″W﻿ / ﻿19.0699906°N 98.1756913°W﻿ / 19.0699906; -98.1756913
